newsitem.title: KENYA: Nairobi bourse index climbs in mixed market.
newsitem.headline: Nairobi bourse index climbs in mixed market.

text.p: The Nairobi Stock Exchange 20-share index gained marginally in Friday trading on modest demand for key shares, bourse officials said.
The index rose 17.79 points to close at 3345.14.
Turnover was posted at 16.686 million shillings on 430,410 shares compared to 22.860 million shillings on 438,270 shares on Thursday.
"We're probably going to see more fluctuations, especially if these small purchases remain consistent, because the shares in demand are scarce," a senior broker said.
Another dealer observed that because demand was for specific shares, the rise in the index could not be seen as a long-term trend.
Publishing group Nation Printers & Publishers gained 8.00 shillings to close at 126.00 on speculative buying in hopes of an expected bonus issue to be released with year-end results.
"For the kind of assets they are carrying, the company is not adequately capitalized," a financial analyst said.
The group recently completed a printing plant estimated to raise total fixed assets to one billion shillings.
Dealers said that with 11 million shares at a face value of 5.00 shillings, the group was heavily under-capitalized.
Other climbers were Kenya Airways at 8.20 from 8.05, Uchumi Supermarket at 38.00 from 37.00 and Total Kenya at 64.00 from 62.50.
Barclays Bank eased to 99.00 from 100.00 while Standard Chartered Bank closed at 44.75 from 46.00.
Kenya Commercial Bank was unchanged at 95.00 while Kenya Power & Lighting closed unchanged at 120.00.
Brooke Bond lost five shillings to close at 127.00 while Rea Vipingo Plantations was unchanged at 9.00.
